Miscellaneous Highlights: The Red Devils are still yet to win on English soil in eight attempts, and they have never come closer to doing so than in their most recent trip in March 2024, when Belgium led deep into injury time, before Jude Bellingham spared England's blushes with a leveller in the 95th minute.
Others: England and Belgium played numerous friendlies against each other before the advent of major international tournaments, as the inter-war period saw these two face off 10 times, with the Three Lions winning eight - scoring 42 goals in the process.
England and Belgium would then be drawn together again in the UEFA Nations League in 2020, with both games being played behind closed doors amid the COVID-19 lockdowns.

Belgium won the group despite losing 2-1 at Wembley thanks to Marcus Rashford and Mason Mount goals, as strikes from Youri Tielemans and Dries Mertens sealed a 2-0 victory in Leuven to confirm top spot for Roberto Martinez's side.
